data.title: Yummy oils and balsamic vinegars!
data.text: My husband and I decided to take the trek downtown to try the variety of balsamic vingars and olive oils. I must say it was a great experience trying the many blends! Its a must see and try! We walked out with 3 varieties and the staff made the decision easy!

data.title: Too many to chose from!
data.text: Great shop. lots of oils and vinegar. We finally ended up with a lemon oil. Looking forward to doing some cooking with it.

data.title: educational
data.text: Have been there for twice for private parties and found it to be very fun and informative.  Have also stopped in when out of flavored olive oils.... would highly recommend stopping in to do a taste test or purchase your favorite oils and vinegars

data.title: Neat place at John's pass.
data.text: This establishment has unique, quality and specialty oils and spices. A bit pricey but not outrageous.

data.title: Large selection
data.text: The selection is quite large and there's plenty to taste. The owner and staff are very helpful and knowledgeable.

data.title: Like Olive oil?  Go here if you do.
data.text: You just can't imagine how much variety is available here.  You just can't imagine what fun it is to discover such things.

data.title: Great Product
data.text: Great product, selection, people and company.  If you haven't tried their olive oil and vinegar you are missing out.

data.title: Olives oh my!
data.text: Great place to taste crafted olive oils.. Huge selection! In the heart of St. Petersburg. Great service and knowledge!

data.title: Great Selection and Helpful
data.text: I shop here and have attended a cooking session.  They are friendly and very helpful.  James is a stitch and we enjoy his humor.

data.title: Shopping is fun here!
data.text: My pantry is practically an outlet of Kalamazoo Olive Company.  The oils and vinegars are excellent quality:  my favorite oil is the butter--it contains no butter whatsoever, but tastes of it, and so it is a great healthy way to add the flavor of butter to sautes, to fish, to roasted vegetables, whatever, without actually using butter.  In the shop, you can taste anything and everything, and you'll be given tips on how to cook with the oils and vinegars, as well as what combinations go together well.  Sale days are bargain heaven:  especially make a point to go on Small Business Saturday (the Saturday after Thanksgiving).  Everyone who walks through the door, on any day, is greeted like a long-lost friend; lots of laughing, too--the people in this store are hilarious, on top of every other great quality the place has.

data.title: personal attention in helping to select quality olive oil with multiple tastings.
data.text: We had a positive experience and will return again. If you want quality products and the opportunity to sample this is this is the place for you.

data.title: Olives Everywhere
data.text: I actually have not yet visited the shop on Central but am thrilled to find Kalamazoo Olive Co, at various fresh markets - most notably the Saturday Morning Market downtown St. Pete. The flavors combine to create amazing flavor.

data.title: Shopping Heaven for the Foodie
data.text: Foodie shoppers have to try this place out. All you can taste samples of amazing oils and vinegars, wine, and specialty food items.

data.title: I don't want to be repetitive but "tasting" :)
data.text: Great shop- Lots of "tasting"  options with oils and vinegar's.  Staff helpful- Oils and Vinegar's are all nicely labeled and available for small taste samples.  They have some seasonal   balsamic  ( apple being one) you will love.

data.title: Vinegar on Ice Cream? Yes!
data.text: The Kalamazoo Olive Company has been copied for the wonderful idea of having some of the highest quality olive oils and vinegar I have ever found. It is amazing how wonderful a quality vinegar will make a fresh salad taste as well as a bowl of vanilla ice cream. Way to go Jim.

data.title: Excellent products! I got a gal in Kalamazoooooo
data.text: I was immediately attracted to this shop because of the name.  I am originally from Michigan and lived in Kalamazoo.  Their olive oils and balsamic vinegar are divine.  I love that you can bring your bottle back and they give you a discount on your refill.  This is a fine local establishment.  I love that it is not a big box grocery and that they care about their customers.

data.title: Cheers!
data.text: Lot of oil and vinegars to try. I LOVE their Aged Balsamic. You can literally drink it like wine. A little pricy.

data.title: Strawberry vinegar! Lots to sample
data.text: All kinds of olive oils and vinegars.  The vinegars ar the best--delicious! And I don't even like vinegar!  They also have a few packages items like pasta and everything I've purchased was good.

data.title: St Pete's EVOO Place
data.text: If you are into EVOO in a big way, Kalamazoo is for you. They have a huge selection of olive oils-flavored or not. You can taste test each one. Take care--you could gain pounds! There is also a good selection of vinegars and other foods that pair nicely with oils. The staff is a great help and very friendly. I did a great deal of Christmas shopping there last December.

data.title: Olive Oil With a Hefty Side of Attitude
data.text: Let me begin by saying I know good olive oil and the products they have here are fine. I'm amazed, however, that service people who, presumably, rely on repeat customers, don't manage to mask a demeanor that is so arrogant and dismissive that one wonders if they are filming some kind of "gotcha" show on the premises. There are plenty of places to get excellent olive oil in the area without putting up with the attitude.
